articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Factories in Kanggye City
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Factories in Kanggye City
						
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to factories in Kanggye City.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the Kanggye General Tractor Plant.
					
					 While going round different shops of the plant and the newly manufactured machines, he acquainted himself in detail with the technological updating and production there.
					
					 After watching various type CNC-based machines that stand in rows at every worksite and quality processed machine parts, he expressed great satisfaction over the rapid progress made by the plant in production by putting all its production processes on a CNC basis and developing new technology. 
					
					 He highly praised the officials, workers and technicians of the plant for their feats, saying they are the genuine builders of a thriving nation, ardent patriots and fighters devotedly implementing the Party's policies as they are transforming their plant in a revolutionary way.
					
					 The plant, a model of modernization, set an example not only in production but in supply service for the workers and cultured practices in production and hygiene, he said, calling upon all the units to learn from their experience.
					
					 He advanced important tasks to serve as guidelines for the management and operation of the plant and production there. 
					
					  He set the target to be attained by the plant in the near future and indicated the concrete orientation and ways to do so.
					
					 The second leg of his guidance was the Kanggye Koryo Medicine Factory.
					
					 Making the rounds of various places of the factory, he learned in detail about the technological updating and production there. 
					
					 He was greatly satisfied to see the factory mass-producing highly efficacious Koryo medicines by sprucing up itself hygienically and culturally as befitting a pharmaceutical factory and using various kinds of medicinal herbs found in abundance in its local area.
					
					 The factory has registered many achievements in the drive to put Koryo medicines on an extract and scientific basis, he said, praising the officials, workers and technicians of the factory for having worked hard to promote the people's health.
					
					 He set forth the tasks facing the factory.
					
					 It is of weighty significance in promoting the people's health to develop Koryo medicines as they are good ones which have long been widely used in Korea, he said.
					
					  He underscored the need for the factory to mass-produce Koryo medicines and supply them to the Kanggye citizens and other people as it has laid a solid material and technological foundation for putting Koryo medicines on an industrial and scientific basis and has a wealth of experience.
					
					 All the Koryo medicines produced by the factory should be good to take and highly efficacious, he said, stressing the need to produce more famous medicines conducive to promoting the people's health.
					
					 He expressed great expectation and conviction that the officials, workers and technicians of the factory would bring about a new turn in medicine production.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, Kim Kyong Hui, member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Pak To Chun and Thae Jong Su, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Ju Kyu Chang, alternate member of the Political Bureau and department director of the C.C., the WPK, and Ju Yong Sik, chief secretary of the Jagang Provincial Committee of the WPK.

articles.title: Supreme People's Assembly Meets
articles.content:
Supreme People's Assembly Meets
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The Fourth Session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK was held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday. 
					 Present there were deputies to the SPA.
					
					 Also attending it as observers were officials of party, armed forces and power organs, public organizations, ministries and national institutions and those in the fields of science, education, culture and arts, public health and media.
					
					 The Session discussed the following agenda items:
					
					1. On the work of the DPRK Cabinet in Juche 99 (2010) and its tasks for Juche 100 (2011)
					
					2. On the results of the implementation of the DPRK state budget for Juche 99 (2010) and its state budget for Juche 100 (2011)
					
					3. Organizational matter
					
					 Deputy Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK, made a report on the first agenda item.
					
					 He said that last year witnessed the signal advance in making the national economy Juche-oriented and the solid foundation for a drastic turn in developing the light industry and agricultural production. Big successes were made in development of science and technology, cultural construction and other fields, he noted.
					
					 He referred to the concrete tasks for this year, stressing the need to remarkably increase the production of consumer goods and attain the goal of grain production without fail to bring about decisive turn in improving the standard of people's living. Production should be increased in the economic field as a whole while steadily pushing ahead with the drive to put the national economy on a modern basis, he added. 
					
					  Deputy Pak Su Gil, vice-premier and minister of Finance, made a report on the second agenda item.
					
					 He noted that last year's state budget revenue was overfulfilled 1.3 percent and the state budgetary expenditure was implemented at 99.9 percent. The revenue increased 7.7 percent while the expenditure swelled 8.2 percent over the previous year, he said, adding: 
					
					 The state budgetary allocations for light industry and agriculture last year showed 10.9 percent and 9.4 percent increase respectively as compared with that in the previous year. The state budgetary expenditure for the pilot domains of the national economy, basic industrial domains and capital construction last year went up 8 percent and 12.9 percent respectively over the previous year. 
					
					 8.1 percent greater financial disbursement than the previous year was made for the field of science and technology and 6 percent bigger fund than that in the previous year was spent for the implementation of the popular policies. 
					
					 15.8 percent of the total state budgetary expenditure was spent for national defence last year.
					
					 He further said:
					
					 This year the state budgetary revenue is expected to grow 7.5 percent over last year's and the state budgetary expenditure is expected to show an 8.9 percent increase over last year. Huge funds will go to the light industry, agriculture, etc. and 15.8 percent of the total state budgetary expenditure will be spent for national defence.
					
					 Speakers at the Session pointed out that the Cabinet's work last year and the implementation of the state budget were properly reviewed and summed up. This year's tasks have been clearly laid down and the state budget correctly shaped in such a way as to give full play to the advantages of the socialist system in the DPRK, they said, expressing full support and approval of them. 
					
					 They also manifested their will to push ahead with the general offensive for bringing about a decisive turn in building a thriving nation by increasing the political and military power of the country in every way and intensifying the drive for great surge for improving the standard of people's living. 
					
					 The Session adopted with the unanimous approval of deputies the SPA decision "On approving the report on the work of the DPRK Cabinet and the results of the implementation of the DPRK state budget for Juche 99 (2010)" and the DPRK SPA ordinance "On the DPRK state budget for Juche 100 (2011) ".
					
					 Then the Session discussed the organizational matter.
					
					 Deputy Jon Pyong Ho was recalled from member of the DPRK National Defence Commission due to the transfer to other post and Deputy Pak To Chun was elected to fill the vacancy.
					
					 Deputy Ri Myong Su was appointed as minister of People's Security of the DPRK NDC.
					
					 Deputy Jang Pyong Gyu was elected chairman of the SPA Legislation Committee to fill the vacancy.
					
					 Deputy Ri Thae Nam was relieved of vice-premier of the Cabinet for his health reason.

articles.title: Report on Work of the Cabinet 2010 and Its Tasks for 2011
articles.content:
Report on Work of the Cabinet 2010 and Its Tasks for 2011
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Deputy Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, made a report on its work last year and its tasks for this year at the Fourth Session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK held Thursday. 
					 He said that the most important achievement gained in the nation's economic development last year was that signal progress was made in putting the national economy on a Juche-basis.
					
					 The inter-departmental structure of the metal industry was refurbished with the new one. The Juche iron production system was successfully established at major metal plants and new alloy steel production bases sprang up.
					
					 Large chemical industrial centres were updated on the basis of the latest science and technology to bring about the mass-production of Juche fiber and Juche fertilizers, signal events. 
					
					 The coal production capacity increased in the field of coal industry. The construction of hydropower stations was completed to create huge additional generating capacity in the field of power industry. The construction of the Huichon Power Station made unprecedentedly rapid progress, opening a bright prospect for completing it by 2012. 
					
					 It was another signal success made in the development of the national economy last year that a solid foundation was laid to bring about a radical turn in the development of light industry and the agricultural production. 
					
					 Spectacular successes were made in the development of science and technology last year and the work to put all sectors of the national economy on a CNC basis made dynamic progress. 
					
					 Scientists and technicians succeeded in the nuclear fusion, stunning the world. Products based on cutting-edge technology were developed and big progress was made in the development of bio-engineering. 
					
					 The reporter said that this year the DPRK Cabinet would significantly boost the production of consumer goods and attain the target of grain production without fail and thus bring about a decisive turn in improving the standard of people's living and continue energetically pushing forward the updating of the national economy while forcefully waging the drive for increased production in all economic sectors. 
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The Cabinet will make this year a year in which light industry will advance in full gear and the people will benefit from it and, at the same time, dynamically push ahead with the work to put the production of consumer goods on a modern and scientific basis. 
					
					 It will focus all efforts on attaining the target of grain production by bringing about signal innovations in farming with the whole party, country and army and all the people involved. 
					
					 It will thoroughly establish a food production system of agricultural production and stock breeding and that of fruit farming and stock breeding and reenergize the production at the modern stock breeding and fruit production centers in a bid to simultaneously boost the production of livestock products, fruits and grain. It will make sure that a turn is effected in the development of fruit farming, in particular, this year. 
					
					 The Cabinet will see to it that the material and technical foundation will be consolidated in the fishery domain to conduct deep-sea fishing, small-scale fishing and shallow-sea culture in a big way and put fish farming on a scientific and intensive basis to produce and supply greater quantities of aquatic products and processed fishes and seafood to the people. 
					
					 It will improve and strengthen the service to the people to fully meet their need and provide better convenience in their lives. 
					
					 It will decisively increase the production in all sectors of the national economy including the four pilot sectors in an effort to give strong spurs to the ongoing march for a signal improvement in the standard of people's living. 
					
					 The Cabinet will make sure that the coal production will be radically boosted in the field of coal industry while the coal production capacity will be increased under a long-term plan. 
					
					 It will see to it that the field of power industry will operate all generating equipment in full capacity while rationally forming a system of transmission and distribution to make the most effective use of the electricity produced. 
					
					 It will accelerate the building of large-scale hydro and thermal power plants while focusing sustained state efforts on the construction of the Huichon Power Station in a bid to provide a sure guarantee for hitting the target of electricity production. 
					
					 The Cabinet will make sure that the field of metal industry will consolidate and develop the Juche-oriented iron production system and method. It will see to it that the introduction of heavy duty rails and the modernization of railways will be accelerated and transport capacity boosted in the field of railway transport to satisfactorily ease the strain on transport. 
					
					 It will make sure that the field of mining industry will keep production going at a high rate and dynamically push forward updating while laying a foundation for ensuring a more satisfactory production and supply of nonferrous metal products under a long-term plan. 
					
					 The field of machine-building industry will energetically step up the work to put machine plants on a CNC basis, ensure a satisfactory production and supply of generating equipment and machines and equipment necessary for the modernization of the national economy. The field of electronics industry will boost the production of varieties of electronic elements and products and the IT field would contribute to putting the national economy on an IT basis. 
					
					The field of construction will dynamically push forward the construction of important projects including the Hungnam gasification project, Tanchon Port, the sacred site of Thaekwon-Do and the building of 100,000 flats in Pyongyang so as to complete them at the earliest possible date.
					
					 The fields of land administration and urban management will radically change the appearance of the country as befitting a thriving nation and provide better living conditions and environment to the people. 
					
					 The field of scientific research will radically develop such core basic technologies and cutting-edge science and technology including IT and bio-engineering and satisfactorily settle scientific and technological issues arising in building an economic power. 
					
					 The Cabinet will see to it that foreign trade will be diverse and multi-faceted to decisively increase the volume of export. 
					
					 The Cabinet will conduct a positive work for making an effective use of levers for economic and technological cooperation in the direction of consolidating the foundation of the DPRK's socialist self-supporting economy. 
					
					 It will make sustained great efforts for the provision of materials needed for boosting the combat capability of the People's Army and the defence capability of the country in every way and the development of the field of socialist cultural construction. 
					
					The reporter called on everybody to work hard to emerge honorable victors in the general offensive this year to significantly greet the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, united close around the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by General Secreatry Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Report on Implementation of State Budget for 2010 and 2011
articles.content:
Report on Implementation of State Budget for 2010 and 2011
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Deputy Pak Su Gil, vice-premier and minister of Finance, delivered a report on the results of the implementation of the DPRK state budget for last year and its state budget for this year at the Fourth Session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly held on Thursday.
					 According to the report, last year's state budgetary revenue was overfulfilled 1.3 percent and its plan for state budgetary expenditure was carried out at 99.9 percent. 
					
					  The state budgetary allocations for light industry and agriculture last year showed a 10.9 percent and 9.4 percent increase respectively as compared with that in the previous year. The state budgetary expenditure for the pilot domains of national economy, basic industrial domains and capital construction last year went up 8 percent and 12.9 percent respectively over the previous year. 
					
					 8.1 percent greater financial disbursement than the previous year was made for the field of science and technology and 6 percent bigger fund than that in the previous year was spent for the implementation of the popular policies. 
					
					 15.8 percent of the total state budgetary expenditure was spent for national defence last year.
					
					 The state budget for this year has been shaped in such a way as to radically boost the light industry and agricultural production, revitalize the overall economic construction and conduct a dynamic drive to break through the latest science and technology in all fields to lay a solid foundation for an economic power.
					
					 This year's plan for state budgetary revenue is expected to grow 7.5 percent over last year's. 
					
					 The national budgetary revenue is expected to hold 83.9 percent of the total state budgetary revenue and local budgetary revenue 16.1 percent. 
					
					 The revenue from transaction and the profits of state-run enterprises are expected to hold 78.5 percent of the total state budgetary revenue this year and the profits of cooperative organizations, the fixed asset depreciation, the income from real estate rent and social insurance are expected to swell 3.8 percent, 1.4 percent, 0.7 percent and 0.4 percent respectively as compared with those last year.
					
					 This year's plan for state budgetary expenditure is expected to show an 8.9 percent increase over last year. The budgetary allocation for the light industry is expected to go up 12.9 percent and a huge budgetary disbursement will be made for local industry, too.
					
					 9 percent more funds than last year will go to agriculture, funds needed for farming will be provided on a priority basis and the expenditure for the pilot domains and basic industries of the national economy is expected to go up 13.5 percent over last year.
					
					 The financial allocation for the capital construction will go up 15.1 percent over last year to hasten the construction of important objects and complete them at the earliest possible date. 10.1 percent bigger financial allocation than last year will be made for scientific and technological development in order to fulfill the five-year plan for state scientific and technological development, positively push forward the work for putting industrial domains on a modern and CNC basis and successfully solve scientific and technical issues arising in the building of an economic power.
					
					 Huge funds will go to the cultural construction and land improvement and city management. 
					
					 15.8 percent of the total state budgetary expenditure is expected to be spent for national defence for this year.
					
					 A large amount of educational aid fund and stipends will be sent for the children of Koreans in Japan this year, too.
					
					 For the successful fulfillment of the state budget for this year it is necessary for all domains and units of the national economy to give full play to the mental power of the producer masses, economize manpower, materials and funds and cut down as much as possible nonproductive expenditure and thus carry out the monthly and quarterly plans for budgetary revenue without fail, the reporter stressed.

articles.title: Minister of People's Security Appointed
articles.content:
Minister of People's Security Appointed 
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Ri Myong Su was appointed as minister of People's Security of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK. 
					 A decision of the NDC was made public Thursday in this connection.

articles.title: Ri Thae Nam Relieved of His Post
articles.content:
Ri Thae Nam Relieved of His Post 
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Ri Thae Nam was relieved of his post as vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet for his health reason.
					 A decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly was promulgated on April 7 in this regard.

articles.title: Radioactive Substances Found
articles.content:
Radioactive Substances Found
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Radioactivity monitoring stations throughout the DPRK have detected radioactive particles in the air -- radioactive iodine-131 and cesium-137 apparently from the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant of Japan. 
					 Their density was tested to be about 0.03mBq and 0.04mBq per cubic meter respectively.
					
					 The amount of iodine-131 is one two hundred and forty thousandth of the permitted limit. Experts are of the view that it does not cause public health concern. 
					
					 The stations have strengthened the monitoring of radioactive substances.

articles.title: Ten-Day Film Show Opens
articles.content:
Ten-Day Film Show Opens
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- A ten-day film show opened in the DPRK to commemorate the Day of the Sun, birthday of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Documentary and feature films will be screened at cinemas and cultural houses in Pyongyang and localities in the period.
					
					 The documentaries include "Finding Himself among the People All His Life", "President Kim Il Sung with the Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Veterans" and "They Were Always Together on the Road to Bring about the People's Well-being" while the feature films "Star of Korea", "The Sun of the Nation", "The Great Embrace" and "The Bright Morning".
					
					 Its opening ceremony took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday. 
					
					 Present there were Kang Nung Su, vice-premier of the Cabinet, officials concerned and officials of ministries and national institutions.
					
					 Minister of Culture An Tong Chun made an opening address.
					
					 Similar ceremonies were also held in provinces on the same day to start the ten-day film show.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Chinese Family
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Chinese Family
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket by the family of Zhang Weihua, an anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr of China, Thursday on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of his election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.

articles.title: Foreigners Here
articles.content:
Foreigners Here
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ukrainian Independence Federation led by Chairman Vitali Kulik arrived here by air on Thursday to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Arriving to attend the 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival were a Chinese art troupe (the Jilin Provincial Symphony Orchestra and the Xiamen Xiaobailu folk dance troupe) and an acrobatic troupe of China.

articles.title: National Seminar on Copyright and Related Rights Held
articles.content:
National Seminar on Copyright and Related Rights Held
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- A national seminar on copyright and related rights took place here on April 6 and 7.
					 Attending it were officials of the Copyright Secretariat of the DPRK and in the fields of education, literature and arts, media and IT industry and members of the World Intellectual Property Organization and Chinese and Malaysian delegates on a visit to the DPRK.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Speakers referred to the importance of the work for copyrights, saying that the seminar would offer an opportunity to have a deep understanding of the global development of copyright system and advanced experience in this field.
					
					 They stressed that it would mark a significant occasion in further developing the international exchange and cooperation in the field of copyrights.
					
					 Then there were speeches on such subjects as "Development of Copyrights in the DPRK", "Work for Protecting Copyright and Related Rights in the DPRK", "The Importance of Respect for Copyright and Related Rights and Social Understanding of Them" and "The Positive Impact of Copyright and Related Rights on Social Economic and Cultural Development".
					
					 They referred to the issue of further developing the copyrights as required by the era of knowledge-based economy in the 21st century and underscored the need to improve and perfect the copyright protection system to enrich the intellectual wealth of the country.

articles.title: World Health Day Marked
articles.content:
World Health Day Marked 
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- An event took place here on Thursday to mark World Health Day. 
					 Present were officials of the Ministry of Public Health, the Ministry of Agriculture, the Education Commission and media organs and health workers in Pyongyang, the representative of the World Health Organization and members of its mission and others of missions of international bodies here. 
					
					 Speeches were made at the event. 
					
					 Speakers noted that the WHO set the combating antimicrobial resistance as subject for this year.
					
					 They stressed the need to suitably use sensitive antimicrobial medicines and solve the problems related to this. 
					
					 The participants watched a video on the combating antimicrobial resistance and enjoyed a performance given by a hygienic information team of health workers. 
					
					 Intensive hygienic information activities were conducted in different provinces of the country on the same occasion.

articles.title: Concert Indicative of Developing Juche-oriented Art
articles.content:
Concert Indicative of Developing Juche-oriented Art
						
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- A concert of artistes of the Mansudae Art Troupe and the Orchestra of the Yun I Sang Music Institute is going on in Pyongyang.
					The concert, beginning with an orchestral music "We Live in the Embrace of the Leader", praises the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il through numbers like a female vocal solo "Cantata to Comrade Kim Jong Il". It also reflects the independent and creative life the Korean people enjoy in the socialist country.
					
					 Women's violin nonet "Let's Become the General's Soldiers" and string quartet "Tankman and Girl" show the strong will of the Korean soldiers and people to uphold the revolutionary cause of Juche with arms.
					
					Conspicuous in the concert is a pizzicato ensemble "Cuckoo". 
					
					 The performance wins warm applause from the audience for its high ideological and artistic plane.

articles.title: Hygienic, Anti-epidemic Program
articles.content:
Hygienic, Anti-epidemic Program
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The National Hygienic and Anti-epidemic Center has developed a hygienic and anti-epidemic program.
					The data management program helps give a quick and correct warning against epidemic diseases and make a real-time epidemiological analysis.    
					
					 It also provides scientific information needed to prevent outbreak of diseases and their spread in time.
					
					 It has already proved effective in many units.

articles.title: Developing Fruit Farming of DPRK
articles.content:
Developing Fruit Farming of DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Fruit farming has made a signal progress in the DPRK in recent years.
					 Large fruit producers have been built in all parts of the country and the material and technical foundations of the country's fruit farming consolidated.
					
					 Several thousand hectares have been cultivated in orchards throughout the country to reap fruits one or two years after sampling planting.
					
					 Dwarf apple trees have been planted in Pukchong and Toksong of South Hamgyong Province, Hwangju of North Hwanghae Province, Tongrim of North Phyongan Province, Jangyon of South Hwanghae Province, Onchon of Nampho city and other areas.
					
					 Pomological research institutes, experimental farms and fruit tree nurseries have been updated to cultivate high-yielding fruit trees of good species.
					
					 A new irrigation method has been applied to fruit farms and farm machines and agrochemicals have been fully supplied to them.
					
					 All fruit farms are equipped with fertilizer production bases.

articles.title: Basic Feed for Marine Animals
articles.content:
Basic Feed for Marine Animals 
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The Microbiological Research Institute under the DPRK State Academy of Sciences has developed basic feed for economically useful marine animals.
					 The institute succeeded in taking eight kinds of single-celled algae from the sea and found out their specific features. It then devised methods of separating a thoroughbred from them and preserving it in a solid state.
					
					 It also developed a technology of culturing single-celled algae in an intensive way and raising economically useful marine animals.
					
					 The technology has already proved effective in some fishery stations.

articles.title: Proper Solution to Jeju April 3 Case Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Proper Solution to Jeju April 3 Case Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- A memorial service took place on Jeju Island of south Korea on April 3 on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the April 3 Popular Uprising.
					 The governor of the island said at a memorial service that there was nowhere in the world such a case in which the whole region was suppressed as the Jeju April 3 case.
					
					 An early settlement of the case is an important primary task for winning peace and human rights, he noted.
					
					 He stressed the need for the authorities to take such relevant steps as quickly instituting the day of commemorating the uprising and properly writing its history in textbooks.
					
					 A spokesman for the Democratic Party of south Korea in a commentary that day deplored that the Jeju April 3 tragedy still remains unsettled due to the authorities' distortion of history.
					
					 He urged the authorities to discontinue distorting history and probe the truth about the massacre at that time and take a responsible option for reinstating those killed.

articles.title: End to Foreign Forces' Domination and Interference Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
End to Foreign Forces' Domination and Interference Demanded in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification released a statement on April 3 on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the Popular Uprising on Jeju Island.
					 The April 3 resistance dealt a heavy blow at the plots of the U.S. imperialists and pro-American stooges to establish a separate "government". This great struggle showed how ardent and urgent the desire of the Korean nation to build an independent and sovereign state and reunify the country was, the statement said.
					
					 The uprisers' voices condemning the U.S. imperialists and traitor Syngman Rhee that day seem to ring out still today, it noted.
					
					 It stressed that the people from all walks of life should wage a more dynamic struggle to build a reunified country by putting an end to the foreign domination and interference and implementing the June 15 joint declaration in the same spirit of independence and unity as displayed by the uprisers.

articles.title: Seminars Held Abroad to Commemorate Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Seminars Held Abroad to Commemorate Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung
						
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Seminars took place in Nepal and France on March 29 and 30 to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Present there were personages of political parties and organizations and popular masses of those countries. They included the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), the National Democratic Party of Nepal, the Nepali national preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16, the Nepal-Korea Friendship Association, the Nepal Institute for the Juche Studies, the Nepalese Association for Supporting the Songun Politics and the French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Idea.
					
					 At the seminar in Nepal speakers eulogized the feats performed by Kim Il Sung in liberating Korea and winning the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. They said with high appreciation that he is the great man none of the statesmen in the world can match.
					
					 Jean Marie Lambret, chief of the French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Idea, said: The Korean people call their country Kim Il Sung's Korea and their nation Kim Il Sung's nation because his feats are so great and immortal.
					
					 Messages to leader Kim Jong Il were adopted at the seminars.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Commemorated in Cambodia
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Commemorated in Cambodia
						
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- King Norodom Sihamoni and Great King Norodom Sihanouk of Cambodia sent big floral baskets to the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					Upon authorization of the king and the great king, a delegation of the ministry of Royal Palace led by Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister in charge of the Royal Palace, visited the embassy on April 1 to lay the floral baskets before the portraits of Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Il Sung is the benefactor and the closest friend of the Cambodian people as well as the great leader of the Korean people and the eternal president of the DPRK, the deputy prime minister said, adding:
					
					 The king and the great king hope that Kim Il Sung would always live in the hearts of the Korean people and the world progressives. 
					
					 They are happy to see the Korean people make achievements in building a thriving nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, and sincerely wish them bigger success in the future. 
					
					 We hope that the traditional relations of friendship between the two countries provided by Norodom Sihanouk and Kim Il Sung would grow stronger.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Reported by Regional Body
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Reported by Regional Body
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions on March 31 posted on its Internet website "3. Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully" from President Kim Il Sung's work "Report to the Sixth Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the Work of the Central Committee".
					 This part of the work, published on October 10, Juche 69 (1980), deals with the struggle of the Workers' Party of Korea for national reunification conducted in the period under review. And it clarifies the task for achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 It also indicates a new reunification proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo based on the three principles of national reunification and the 10-point policy of the DFRK.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Marked in Mexico
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Marked in Mexico
						
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Mexico issued bulletins carrying a photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il to mark the 18th anniversary of his election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 The Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism carried in the 54th issue of its bulletin an article titled "Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il and the Invincible Korean People's Army".  
					
					 The bulletin said that his election as NDC chairman marked an important occasion in fully demonstrating the KPA as an invincible army.
					
					 It noted with high appreciation that he increased in every way the KPA's might in military technique and directed primary efforts to the development of the defence industry.
					
					 The Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea carried in the 74th issue of its bulletin an article titled "Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il and the Invincible Power" which said: Socialist Korea has fully displayed its might as an invincible power under the leadership of Kim Jong Il over the past 18 years.
					
					 The bulletin noted that penetrating deep into the rapidly-changing world political situation, he has cemented the politico-ideological position of the country as firm as a rock and built the whole country into an impregnable fortress under the banner of the Juche idea and the Songun idea.

articles.title: DPRK's Significant Days Observed
articles.content:
DPRK's Significant Days Observed 
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of Cambodia and Nepal gave special write-ups to the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					 The Cambodian newspaper People on March 23 and 30 carried commemorative articles with photos on revolutionary activities of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The paper, in an article titled "Popular Leader", lauded the undying revolutionary career of the President who founded the immortal Juche idea and dedicated all his life to the people.
					
					 In another article titled "Invincible Military Power and Kim Jong Il" the paper said that Kim Jong Il's election as NDC chairman is the basic guarantee that helped the DPRK fully display its dignity as an invincible military power.
					
					 The Nepali paper Arpan carried an article entitled "The Juche Idea Is Banner of Victory" on March 25.
					
					 Elaborating on the validity and vitality of the Juche idea, the article said: The Juche idea is the banner of victory, the immortal banner of the popular masses hewing out their destiny and struggling to build a new world.

articles.title: Radioactive Substance Leaked from Japan to Reach Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Radioactive Substance Leaked from Japan to Reach Korean Peninsula 
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- A high-level radioactive materials keep leaking from the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant of Japan.
					 A seawater sample taken near the power plant on Monday showed radioactive iodine-131 concentration of about 200,000 Becquerel per cubic centimeter.
					
					 The Tokyo Electric Power Co. said this on Tuesday, clarifying that this is 5 million times the legal limit.
					
					 Right after a crack was discovered in a pit near the No. 2 reactor on April 2, radioactive materials of 300,000 Becquerel more than 7.5 million times the legal limit was detected in the nearby seawater.
					
					 A professor at Tokyo University said that it has become very clear that radiation-contaminated water is flowing into the sea.
					
					 To tackle the situation, the company tried to stop the flow of contaminated water into the sea but failed, according to VOA.
					
					 The Japanese government admitted that it would take several months to do so.
					
					 The director-general of the International Atomic Energy Agency expressed his view that the situation at the power plant "still remains very serious."
					
					 Foreign media said that the detection of radiation-contaminated fishes in the sea 85km away from the power plant sparked anxiety and uneasiness that all the seas around Japan might be contaminated with radiation.
					
					 It is expected that while radioactive materials are still spreading to other parts of the world, they will directly affect the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 MBC of south Korea predicted that radioactive materials that had leaked from the power plant would move to the sky above the peninsula by the eastward wind on Thursday.
					
					 It said there was high possibility that radioactive rain might fall on the peninsula on Thursday, adding that it would be better to avoid direct exposure to rain though it might contain low-level of radiation.
					
					 It reported that radioactive iodine was detected at 12 observatories in south Korea for 4 consecutive days from Saturday and the amounts of radioactive materials detected in Chunchon and Seoul showed a 5-fold and 2.5-fold increase respectively over those observed a week earlier.
					
					 The National Police Agency of Japan announced that the death toll caused by the quake and ensuing tsunami increased to 12,259 and the number of those unaccounted for to 15,315 as of 9 p.m. on Monday.

articles.title: Radiation-contaminated Water Leaks into Sea from Japan Nuclear Plant
articles.content:
Radiation-contaminated Water Leaks into Sea from Japan Nuclear Plant
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Radiation-contaminated water is massively leaking into the sea from the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant of Japan.
					 The Japanese Asahi Shimbun said on April 4 that the Tokyo Electric Power Co. began to release water of relatively low-level radiation into the sea from some facilities of the power plant in order to make room to store a high level of radioactive water. 
					
					It was reported that the power plant will discharge 11,500 tons of contaminated water to the sea in a few days to come.
					
					The Kyodo News Service reported that the volume of high concentration of contaminated water inside turbine rooms of Reactors Nos. 1, 2 and 3 and vertical structures on their sides is estimated to total 60,000 tons.
					
					The FoE, an international non-governmental environment protection organization, in a statement said that it is unbelievable that Japan is releasing more than 10,000 tons of radiation-contaminated water to the sea in violation of the international treaty banning the discharge of radioactive waste.
					
					 On April 6 the Tokyo Electric Power Co. officially announced the level of the measurement of radioactive substance inside the containment vessels of Reactors Nos. 1, 2 and 3 of the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant. According to it, 70 percent of the fuel rods of Reactor No. 1 and 30 percent and 25 percent of those of Reactors Nos. 2 and 3 were confirmed to have been damaged.
					
					 The New York Times on April 5 said that one cannot rule out the danger of the reoccurrence of hydrogen explosion at reactors of the power plant.
					
					 Radioactive rain began to fall in areas south of the Korean Peninsula while the international community is showing increasing concern about the leakage of radiation-contaminated water from Japan.
					
					 South Korean KBS reported on April 7 that the rain which began to fall in the areas of Jeju and North and South Jolla Provinces is steadily spreading to Seoul and inland areas. 
					
					 It said that radioactive substance was detected in the rain which fell on Jeju Island on the same day, adding that there were radioactive iodine and cesium of 2.02 Bq and 0.538 Bq per liter of rainwater, the highest level so far.
					
					 It was reported that this brought lessons at some schools of south Korea and outdoor activities to suspension. 
					
					 The Japan Meteorological Agency predicted that the Korean Peninsula might come under the influence of radioactivity, adding that in case 1 Bq of radioactive substance leaks from the nuclear power plant, radioactive substance of 1 Bq over 1,000 trillion per 1 cubic meter is expected to fall in the southern part of the Korean Peninsula and that equivalent to one hundredth in its central part.
					
					 It was known that the peninsula moved 2.3 cm on an average to the east under the influence of the massive quake in Japan.
					
					 The Japan National Police Agency said that the death toll of the quake and the ensuing tsunami increased to 12,596 and those of the unaccounted for to 14,747 as of 10 a.m. on April 7.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Chile
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Chile
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- An earthquake of 6.0 magnitudes struck Chile on April 2.
					The epicenter was in the northern area of the country.

articles.title: CPLA's 2nd Artillery Turned into Strategic Force
articles.content:
CPLA's 2nd Artillery Turned into Strategic Force
						
 Beijing, April 5 (KCNA) -- The 2nd artillery of the Chinese People's Liberation Army developed into a strategic force equipped with nuclear and conventional weapons.
					 According to the white paper titled "China's National Defence in 2010" released by the Information Office of the State Council of China, the 2nd artillery established a military training system peculiar to strategic missile unit and fully equipped itself with conditions for exercises in base and simulation and network drills. It intensified the drills to cope with complex electronic circumstances.
					
					 It also successfully researched and established a system for testing missile automation, a system for control over theatre tactical commanding, etc. and set a safety record in handling nuclear weapons.

articles.title: Regulations on Media Market Management Announced in China
articles.content:
Regulations on Media Market Management Announced in China
 Beijing, April 5 (KCNA) -- Regulations on the management of publications market were announced in China recently.
					 The regulations require the units and individuals doing publication business through information networks including network to get publication business licenses and prohibit any organization and individual from issuing publications with banned contents.

articles.title: Ideo-political Work Underscored at Chinese State-run Enterprises
articles.content:
Ideo-political Work Underscored at Chinese State-run Enterprises
 Beijing, April 5 (KCNA) -- The Publicity Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Property Supervision and Management Committee of the State Council jointly held a video phone meeting on March 30 at which they conveyed their views on improving and strengthening the ideological and political work at the state-run enterprises and proposed tasks for putting them into practice.
					 The meeting called on the publicity units at various levels to take this work as an important duty and assiduously perform it in the future.

articles.title: Methane Pools Built in Rural Areas of Gansu Province, China
articles.content:
Methane Pools Built in Rural Areas of Gansu Province, China
 Beijing, April 5 (KCNA) -- Methane pools have been built in Gansu Province, China for one million rural households over the past five years. 
					 The province is planning to build methane pools for 100,000 households this year.
					
					 32.7 percent of the rural households in the province are using methane.

articles.title: Russian President on Training of Sports-doctors
articles.content:
Russian President on Training of Sports-doctors 
 Moscow, April 5 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev underlined the need to intensify the training of sports-doctors at his recent talks with coaches and sportspersons. 
					 Instructing some medical universities to introduce the subject of sports-doctor training, he said that major subjects should be revised to revive those in the era of the Soviet Union. 
					
					 This step will provide universities with possibility of training specialists and help students major in sports medicine from the beginning, he added.

articles.title: Foreign Intervention Threatens Iraq's Stability: Ex-Minister
articles.content:
Foreign Intervention Threatens Iraq's Stability: Ex-Minister
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Foreign intervention still threatens the country's stability, former Iraqi Finance Minister Ali Allawi warned.
					 Speaking before members of the Chicago Council on Global Affairs some time ago, he said that the continuous involvement of foreign powers in Iraq's internal affairs is a very dangerous phenomenon.

articles.title: Two American Soldiers Killed in Iraq
articles.content:
Two American Soldiers Killed in Iraq
Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- American soldiers are suffering casualties in Iraq due to military operations of its resistance forces. 
					 Two American soldiers were killed in the rocket attack that struck their unit in southern Iraq on April 2.
					
					Saturday's deaths brought the number of the U.S. military personnel who have died in Iraq since the start of the Iraqi war to at least 4,440.

articles.title: PNA Denounces Israeli Army's Airstrike
articles.content:
PNA Denounces Israeli Army's Airstrike
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The director of the media bureau of the Palestinian National Authority in a statement on April 2 strongly condemned Israeli army's airstrike on the Gaza Strip.
					 That day three militants of Islamic Hamas movement were killed in an Israeli drone airstrike in southern Gaza.
					
					 The Israeli military escalation would take the whole situation to more deterioration, the statement said, adding that Israel is clearly trying to drag the Palestinians to the circle of violence.
					
					 The Palestinians will never stop the resistance against Israel, it said, calling upon the international community to stop the Israeli escalation of violence.

articles.title: Iran Accuses Hollywood
articles.content:
Iran Accuses Hollywood
 Tehran, April 5 (KCNA) -- The Iranian minister of Culture scathingly accused the Hollywood when speaking at an event on April 2.
					 "Hundreds of movies have been made by Hollywood to justify the military presence of the United States in other countries, which indicates the utilization of cultural and artistic instruments for the justification and glorification of Washington's military aims," he said.
					
					 Hollywood depicts itself as an "advocate" of human rights, however, this huge institution actually operates towards the fulfillment of evil objectives of the U.S. government, he noted.

articles.title: Anti-US Demonstration in Afghanistan
articles.content:
Anti-US Demonstration in Afghanistan
						
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- A protest demonstration over Quran burning resumed in Kandahar, Afghanistan, on Sunday.
					 This is the second successive day that people in Kandahar have staged a protest demonstration to condemn the reported burning of Quran by a priest in Florida of the United States recently.
					
					 The protesters while chanting slogans against U.S. called for the punishment of those responsible for the burning of Quran in Florida of America.

articles.title: Archeological Remains Found in Nepal
articles.content:
Archeological Remains Found in Nepal
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Nepali archeologists have recently discovered the ruins of old buildings in eastern Nepal.
					 The remains of walls of buildings made of bricks have been unearthed. An earthen lamp and an urn have been also found at the excavation site.
					
					 The archeological remains found in the area bear a resemblance to those of buildings constructed 2,000 years ago.

articles.title: Ecosystem Affected by Global Warming
articles.content:
Ecosystem Affected by Global Warming 
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Global warming has become a serious problem, threatening the existence and development of humankind.
					 A typical example is the Amazon basin. 
					
					 The region, severely affected by global warming, is emitting carbon dioxide.
					
					 Some time ago, scientists from some countries made a joint survey of the region's ecological environment. The results of the survey show that about 3 million square kilometers along the river were damaged by last year's drought and that the drought-affected plants are likely to emit some 5 billion tons of carbon dioxide. 
					
					 Global warming has put many species of animals and plants on the verge of extermination. 
					
					 It has resulted in considerably decreasing the number of arctic bears and deer and damaging the arctic biodiversity. Peat swamps caused by accumulation of withered plants have spread northward, bringing about a big change in the arctic ecosystem.
					
					 Scientists are of the view that if such dwindling were allowed to go on, 25 percent of the animals and plants would go out of existence by the year 2055.
					
					A biologist said that of the animals in the world 18,000 species are on the verge of extinction.
					
					 A research team of a country predicted that global warming will become more serious in the coming decade and that unless a decisive measure to arrest carbon dioxide is taken as early as possible, a sharp rise in temperature will be seen in the mid-21st century.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia funcion de artistas de la provincia de Jagang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia funcion de artistas de la provincia de Jagang      
Pyongyang, 7 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente   Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, presencio la funcion del Conjunto Artistico de la Provincia de Jagang. 
					Los ejecutantes interpretaron la narracion y coro "Vivimos en el regazo del Lider" y "Gloria a nuestro gran Partido", el solo femenino "Nuestro Lider", el cuarteto femenino y coro "Provincia de Jagang es orgullo de mi pais", el coro "Pasos" y otras piezas de diferentes generos.
					
					Muy contento por esa magnifica funcion de alto nivel ideo-artistico, expreso agradecimiento a los artistas apreciando el exito logrado por ellos en la ocasion.
					
					En el pasado, el Conjunto Artistico de la Provincia de Jagang hizo gran aporte a que los militantes del partido y los trabajadores de la provincia trabajaran con el espiritu de Kanggye mediante sus revolucionarias actividades de creacion artistica, recordo.
					
					Ahora crea muchas obras artisticas de alto nivel ideo-artistico convenientes a la demanda del nuevo siglo cumpliendo satisfactoriamente su mision y deber de verdadero creador y firme defensor de la cultura y arte socialistas, senalo y evaluo de altos los meritos de los artistas del conjunto. 
					
					Elogio la perseverante actitud de creacion de los artistas diciendo que ellos pudieron elevar constantemente el nivel de descripcion porque se esforzaron tenazmente por mejorar sus habilidades artisticas dedicando toda su inteligencia y pasion.
					
					La mision principal del arte jucheano es inculcar al hombre la verdadera idea, la moralidad y la cultura necesarias a su vida independiente, apunto y presento las tareas programaticas para desarrollar el arte que satisfaga el requisito de la epoca del Songun. 
					
					Le acompanaron en ver la funcion Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del Buro Politico y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Pak To Chun y Thae Jong Su, miembros suplentes del Buro Politico y secretarios del CC del PTC, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ju Yong Sik, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Jagang, y otros cuadros de esta provincia, los funcionarios directivos de las fabricas y empresas, los benemeritos e innovadores laborales de la epoca del Songun en la ciudad de Kanggye.

articles.title: Tiene lugar cuarto periodo de sesiones de XII legislatura de la APS
articles.content:
Tiene lugar cuarto periodo de sesiones de XII legislatura de la APS         
Pyongyang, 7 de abril (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 7 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae el cuarto periodo de sesiones de la XII Legislatura de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion los diputados a la APS.
					
					Asistieron tambien en calidad de observador los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, las entidades sociales, los ministerios, los organos centrales y de los dominios de ciencia, educacion, cultura y arte, salud publica, prensa e informacion.
					
					El foro discutio tres puntos de la agenda que siguen:
					
					1. "Sobre las labores del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea para el 99 (2010) de la Era Juche y las tareas para el 100 (2011) de la Era Juche"
					
					2. "Sobre el balance de la ejecucion del presupuesto estatal de la RPDC para el 99 (2010) de la Era Juche y el presupuesto estatal para el 100 (2011) de la Era Juche"
					
					3. "Los problemas de organizacion"
					
					En el informe sobre el primer punto de la agenda, el diputado Choe Yong Rim, primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros, dijo que en el ano pasado se ha logrado un avance trascendental en la jucheanizacion de la economia nacional, se ha preparado la firme base para registrar un cambio radical en el desarrollo de la industria ligera y en la produccion agricola y se han alcanzado grandes exitos en el desarrollo cientifico-tecnico, la construccion cultural, etc. 
					
					Enfatizo que este ano, hay que imprimir  un cambio decisivo en el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo, al incrementar decisivamente la produccion de articulos de consumo popular y alcanzar sin falta la meta de produccion de cereales, y al mismo tiempo, promover con energia la produccion en todas las esferas de economia nacional e impulsar continua y energicamente la modernizacion de la economia nacional, y presento las tareas concretas.
					
					El informe sobre el segundo punto de la agenda estuvo a cargo del diputado Pak Su Gil, vicepremier del CM y ministro de Finanzas.
					
					El dijo que en el ano pasado, el ingreso y el egreso del presupuesto estatal quedaron en 101.3 y 99.9 por ciento, respectivamente, con un crecimiento de 7.7 y 8.2 por ciento en comparacion con 2009.
					
					En comparacion con el ano 2009, en 2010 se aumentaron 10.9 % los desembolsos en la industria ligera, 9.4% en la agricultura, 8% en los dominios priorizados y las industrias basicas de la economia nacional, 12.9 % en la construccion de proyectos principales, 8.1% en el dominio de ciencias y tecnicas y 6% en la implementacion de politicas populares, preciso.
					
					Continuo que el 15.8 por ciento del monto de presupuesto estatal desembolsado fue utilizado como gastos de defensa nacional.
					
					Este ano, el plan de ingresos se aumentara 7.5 %  y el de egresos tendra un exceso de 8.9 %, en comparacion con el ano pasado, presento.
					
					 Agrego que muchos fondos de egresos se invertiran en la industria ligera y la agricultura y el 15.8 por ciento de ellos se gastara para la defensa nacional. 
					
					Los oradores senalaron que se balancearon correctamente las labores del CM y la ejecucion del presupuesto estatal para el ano pasado y expusieron apoyo total y asentimiento al hecho de que se presentaron claramente las tareas del CM para este ano y se trazo justamente el presupuesto estatal con vistas a poner de pleno manifiesto la superioridad del regimen socialista de nuestro pais. 
					
					Manifestaron la decision de consolidar por todos los medios este ano el poderio politico-militar del pais y dinamizar la ofensiva general para registrar un viraje decisivo en la construccion de una gran potencia prospera mediante la lucha por traer gran auge en la mejora de las condiciones de vida del pueblo. 
					
					En la ocasion fueron aprobados por unanimidad la resolucion de la APS de la RPDC "Sobre la aprobacion del informe de las labores del Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC y del balance de la ejecucion del presupuesto estatal para el 99 (2010) de la Era Juche" y el decreto de la APS de la RPDC "Sobre el presupuesto estatal de la RPDC para el 100 (2011) de la Era Juche".
					
					   El conclave discutio los problemas de organizacion.
					
					   En relacion con el cambio del cargo del diputado Jon Pyong Ho, el fue destituido del miembro del CDN de la RPDC y el diputado Pak To Chun fue elegido a este cargo.
					
					   El diputado Ri Myong Su fue designado como ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo del CDN de la RPDC.
					
					   El diputado Jang Pyong Gyu fue elegido como presidente de la Comision de Legislacion de la APS. 
					
					   El diputado Ri Thae Nam fue destituido del vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros por su enfermedad.

articles.title: Pak Su Gil balancea la ejecucion de presupuesto estatal para 2010
articles.content:
Pak Su Gil balancea la ejecucion de presupuesto estatal para 2010       
Pyongyang, 7 de abril (ATCC) -- En el cuarto periodo de sesiones de la XII Legislatura de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea efectuado el dia 7, el diputado Pak Su Gil, vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros y ministro de Finanzas, presento el informe sobre el balance de la ejecucion del presupuesto estatal de la RPDC para 2010 y sobre el presupuesto estatal para 2011.
					Segun el informe, el ingreso y el egreso del presupuesto estatal del ano pasado quedaron en 101.3 y 99.9 por ciento, respectivamente.
					
					En comparacion con el ano 2009,  en 2010 se aumentaron 10.9 % los desembolsos en la industria ligera, 9.4% en la agricultura, 8% en los dominios priorizados y las industrias basicas de la economia nacional, 12.9 % en la construccion de proyectos principales, 8.1% en el dominio de ciencias y tecnicas y 6% en la implementacion de politicas populares.
					
					El 15.8 por ciento del monto de presupuestos estatales desembolsados fue utilizado como gastos de defensa nacional.
					
					El presupuesto estatal para 2011 establece la cantidad de ingreso y egreso en el principio de revitalizar decisivamente la industria ligera y la produccion agricola, dinamizar la construccion economica en general y asegurar la firme base de potencia economica desplegando en todos los dominios la ofensiva para conquistar las tecnologias de punta.
					
					El plan de ingresos del presupuesto estatal para el presente ano se aumentara 7.5 por ciento  en comparacion con el ano pasado.
					
					En el monto de tales ingresos, los del presupuesto central representaran 83.9 por ciento y los del presupuesto local, 16.1 por ciento.
					
					Se preve en este ano que las ganancias provenientes de negocios y de empresas estatales ocuparan 78.5 por ciento del valor total de ingresos y las utilidades de entidades cooperativas, los fondos de amortizacion de bienes fijos y los ingresos por el uso de inmuebles y el seguro social creceran a 103.8%, 101.4%, 100.7% y 100.4%, respectivamente, frente al ano pasado.
					
					El plan de egresos del presupuesto estatal para 2011 tendra un aumento de 8.9 por ciento con respecto al ano pasado y entre ellos, creceran a 112.9 por ciento el desembolso para el dominio de industria ligera y se destinaran muchas sumas a las industrias locales.
					
					Al llegar a 109 por ciento con respecto al ano pasado el egreso para la agricultura en el presupuesto estatal, se invertiran con prioridad los fondos necesarios a esta rama y se aumentara tambien a 113.5 por ciento los egresos para los dominios priorizados y las industrias basicas de economia nacional.
					
					Se elevara a 115.1 por ciento frente al ano pasado el desembolso para la construccion de proyectos principales con vistas a inaugurar cuanto antes los objetos importantes.
					
					Se aumentaran a 110.1 por ciento los gastos para el sector cientifico-tecnico, de modo que se cumpla el plan quinquenal estatal de desarrollo de la ciencia y tecnica, se promuevan activamente la modernizacion y la aplicacion de la tecnologia CNC en los sectores industriales y se resuelvan satisfactoriamente los problemas cientifico-tecnicos que se presentan en la construccion de una potencia economica. 
					
					Se invertiran muchos fondos en la construccion cultural, la administracion territorial y el urbanismo.
					
					Se preve que los gastos de defensa nacional ocuparan el 15.8 por ciento del valor total de egresos del presupuesto estatal.
					
					Este ano tambien, se enviara mucho dinero como subsidios escolares y becas para los hijos de los coreanos residentes en Japon.
					
					A fin de ejecutar exitosamente el presupuesto estatal de este ano, todas las ramas y unidades de economia nacional deben ahorrar la mano de obra, los materiales y los fondos y disminuir los egresos en areas improductivas movilizando a las masas productoras para que se cumplan consecuentemente los planes mensuales y trimestrales de ingresos presupuestarios.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim presenta informe sobre el trabajo del CM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim presenta informe sobre el trabajo del CM
						
Pyongyang, 7 de abril (ATCC) -- En el cuarto periodo de sesiones de la XII legislatura de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, que tuvo lugar este jueves, el diputado Choe Yong Rim, primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros, presento el informe sobre el balance del trabajo del CM de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en el 99 (2010) de la Era Juche y las tareas para el 100 (2011) de la Era Juche.
					El exito mas importante alcanzado en el ano pasado para el desarrollo economico del pais fue el avance trascendental dado en la jucheanizacion de economia nacional, comenzo el informante y continuo:
					
					Se ha preparado de nuevo la estructura de industria metalurgica mediante el perfeccionamiento del sistema de produccion de hierro Juche en las importantes fabricas de la rama y la construccion de nueva base de produccion de acero de aleacion. 
					
					Las bases de industria quimica de gran dimension se han modernizado a base de la ciencia y tecnica ultramodernas, gracias a lo cual se producen en avalancha la fibra y el abono basados en recursos nacionales.
					
					En la industria carbonifera se ha aumentado la capacidad de produccion de carbon.
					
					En tanto, en la industria electrica se vio aumentada la capacidad de generacion por la inauguracion de plantas hidroelectricas y se abrio la perspectiva de terminar hasta el ano 2012 la construccion de la Central Hidroelectrica de Huichon que marcha a un ritmo acelerado. 
					
					Otro exito logrado el ano pasado en el desarrollo de economia nacional es que se ha preparado la firme base para producir un cambio radical en el desarrollo de industria ligera y produccion agricola. 
					
					En el ano pasado, se han alcanzado relevantes exitos en el desarrollo de ciencia y tecnica, y en todos los sectores de economia nacional se dio buen impulso a la introduccion de la tecnologia CNC.
					
					Los cientificos y tecnicos coreanos asombraron al mundo al triunfar en la fusion nuclear conocida como tecnologia supersofisticada. Ademas, se desarrollaron los productos tecnicos sofisticados y se logro gran avance en el desarrollo de biotecnologia.
					
					Este ano, el Consejo de Ministros debe traer un viraje decisivo en la mejora de la vida del pueblo, al aumentar decisivamente la produccion de articulos de consumo popular y alcanzar sin falta la meta de produccion de cereales. Igualmente, tiene que librar con energia la ofensiva productiva en todos los sectores de la economia y promover con dinamismo la modernizacion de ella. 
					
					El Consejo de Ministros convertira este ano en el de auge de la industria ligera para que los habitantes se beneficien realmente de ella y acelerara incesantemente la modernizacion y la cientifizacion de la produccion de articulos de consumo popular. 
					
					Concentrara todas sus fuerzas en alcanzar la meta de produccion de cereales, al levantar grandes innovaciones en la agricultura de este ano movilizando a todo el partido, todo el pais, todo el ejercito y todo el pueblo. 
					
					Establecera el estricto sistema de produccion circular entre agricultura y ganaderia, entre fruticultura y ganaderia y activara la produccion en las bases modernizadas de ganaderia y fruticultura para aumentar simultaneamente la produccion de articulos pecuarios, frutas y cereales. En particular, registrara este ano un cambio en el desarrollo fruticola. 
					
					Desarrollara la pesca en alta mar y en pequena escala y el cultivo maritimo mediante el fortalecimiento de la base material y tecnica de la rama pesquera y cientifizara e intensificara la piscicultura para producir y suministrar mucho mas productos maritimos y pescados procesados a los habitantes. 
					
					Mejorara el servicio al pueblo, cubrira las demandas de los habitantes y les facilitara mayor confort de vida.
					
					Aumentara de manera decisiva la produccion en la economia nacional en conjunto, incluso 4 ramas avanzadas, y promovera la marcha de gran auge de hoy por el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo.
					
					En la rama de industria carbonifera deben aumentar la produccion de carbon y ampliar con vistas al futuro la capacidad productiva. 
					
					La industria electrica debe asegurar el pleno funcionamiento de las instalaciones generadoras, componer racionalmente el sistema de transmision y distribucion de energia electrica y aprovechar en maxima eficiencia la electricidad producida. 
					
					Seguira concentrando la fuerza estatal en la obra de la Central Hidroelectrica de Huichon y acelerara la edificacion de otras centrales hidroelectricas y termoelectricas de gran tamano para dar la garantia del alcance de la meta de produccion electrica. 
					
					La industria metalurgica debe consolidar mas el autoctono sistema y metodo de produccion de hierro. 
					
					Y en el transporte ferroviario deben hacer mas pesadas y modernizadas las vias ferroviarias y elevar decisivamente la capacidad de transporte para aflojar la tensa situacion de la rama. 
					
					La industria extractiva tiene que normalizar la produccion, impulsar la modernizacion y preparar con vistas al futuro la base para producir suficientes productos de metales no ferrosos.
					
					La industria de maquinaria aplicara la tecnologia CNC en las fabricas mecanicas, producira y suministrara suficientemente los equipos generadores, las maquinas y equipos necesarios a la modernizacion de economia nacional. 
					
					La industria electronica aumentara la produccion de componentes y productos electronicos de distintos tipos. Y la rama de IT se esforzara por realizar la informatizacion de la economia nacional. 
					
					La rama de construccion impulsara y finalizara con antelacion la construccion de los importantes proyectos como la gasificacion de Hungnam, el puerto de Tanchon, la villa de Taekwondo, viviendas para 100 mil familias en la ciudad de Pyongyang, etc.
					
					Las ramas de administracion territorial y el urbanismo deben renovar la fisonomia general del pais con visos de la gran potencia prospera y asegurar al pueblo mejores condiciones de vida y habitat. 
					
					A la rama de investigacion cientifica le compete desarrollar trascendentalmente la tecnologia basica y sofisticada, incluso la IT y la biotecnologia, y resolver satisfactoriamente los problemas cientifico-tecnicos que se presentan en la construccion de potencia economica.
					
					El Consejo de Ministros aumentara decisivamente las exportaciones mediante la diversificacion de comercio exterior.
					
					En direccion de consolidar la base de la economia independiente socialista de Corea, establecera la cientifica estrategia de inversiones, mejorara el ambiente de inversiones e introducira la ciencia y tecnica de punta y los fondos. Al mismo tiempo, desarrollara activamente las labores para aprovechar eficientemente los espacios de cooperacion economica y tecnica como el comercio de carbon y la creacion de zona economica verde.
					
					El Consejo de Ministros seguira prestando profunda atencion al suministro de materiales para consolidar por todos los medios la combatividad del Ejercito Popular y la defensa nacional del pais y al desarrollo de construccion de la cultura socialista. 
					
					Por ultimo, el informante exhorto a todos a luchar dinamicamente, unidos compactamente en torno al Comite Central del PTC encabezado por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, por ser triunfadores honrados en la ofensiva general de este ano para conmemorar significativamente el centenario de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Rey y gran rey de Camboya envian cestos de flores a la embajada coreana
articles.content:
Rey y gran rey de Camboya envian cestos de flores a la embajada coreana
						
Pyongyang, 7 de abril (ATCC) -- Con motivo del dia de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung, el rey de Cambodia, Norodom Sihamoni, y el gran rey Norodom Sihanouk enviaron grandes cestos de flores a la embajada coreana en su pais.
					  Por encargo de los remitentes, la delegacion del Ministerio del Palacio Real del gobierno del Reino de Camboya encabezada por el vicepremier encargado de este palacio, Kong Sam Ol, visito el dia primero la embajada coreana y los depositaron al pie de los retratos del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					  En la ocasion, el vicepremier dijo que Su Excelencia Generalisimo Kim Il Sung es gran lider del pueblo coreano, Presidente eterno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, benefactor y amigo mas intimo del pueblo de Camboya.
					
					  Su Majestad Norodom Sihamoni y Su Majestad Norodom Sihanouk desean que el Presidente este siempre presente en el corazon del pueblo coreano y los otros progresistas del mundo, indico y prosiguio:
					
					  Nos alegramos mucho de que el pueblo coreano lograra grandes exitos en la construccion de la gran potencia prospera  bajo la sabia direccion de Su Excelencia Mariscal Kim Jong Il y le deseamos sinceramente que tenga mayores exitos en lo adelante.
					
					Deseamos que se fortalezcan y se desarrollen mas las tradicionales relaciones de amistad entre ambos paises preparadas por Su Majestad Norodom Sihanouk y Su Excelencia Generalisimo Kim Il Sung.
